name: Blueground | Paseo de Gracia, furnished
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this stylish La Dreta de l'Eixample furnished two bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and cozy living room with great balcony views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Barcelona has to offer! (ID #BCN95)
neighborhood_overview:
This busy district in central Barcelona is characterized by wide streets and an elegant atmosphere. L'Eixample is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, including buildings by Antoni Gaudí, and the shopping and dining around the Plaça de Catalunya and along Passeig de Gracia.

This neighborhood is renowned for its upscale shopping and dining, including international boutiques and upmarket restaurants on the Passeig de Gràcia and Rambla de Catalunya. Dreta de l’Eixample is also home to La Sagrada Familia, the iconic (and unfinished) masterwork from architect Antoni Gaudí.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Camp de l'Arpa is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood located in the city of Barcelona, Spain. Situated in the Sant Martí district, it offers a unique blend of residential areas, commercial spaces, and a sense of community. Here's a description of Camp de l'Arpa neighborhood:

Residential Atmosphere: Camp de l'Arpa primarily consists of residential buildings, which include a mix of apartments, townhouses, and some traditional Catalan houses. The streets are lined with buildings of varying architectural styles, reflecting the area's rich history.

Local Charm: The neighborhood has a distinct local charm, with narrow streets, small squares, and a relaxed atmosphere. It is known for its tight-knit community and friendly neighbors. Residents often gather in the squares and parks, creating a sense of belonging and fostering social interactions.

host_about:
Hi there,

My name is Enrique and I am a Barcelona Local. I have always loved traveling myself, but also sharing the beauty and wonders of Barcelona with others, so a few years ago I started renting out 2 apartments to travelers coming to the city, always meeting everyone in person so I could share my insights and hidden secrets about Barcelona :)

Now I rent out a few more apartments and it is no longer just me, but we are a small team of people managing the apartments together, but with the same focus on personal and attentive services in authentic apartments that allow for the genuine Barcelona feel for your trip! We call our little team Stay U-nique, because of this focus on a unique feeling when staying with us.

If you have any questions, want to hear about an apartment or just say hi, don´t hesitate to reach out :)

Have a great day!
Enrique

name: Cozy and well-appointed apartment
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled between the bustling city center and the tranquil outskirts, Sants offers a perfect balance for travelers seeking an authentic Barcelona experience. With its rich history, vibrant streets, and friendly atmosphere, this neighborhood has something to offer for everyone.

Sants is renowned for its excellent transportation links, making it a fantastic base for exploring the city. The Sants Estació, one of Barcelona's major transportation hubs, provides easy access to both national and international destinations. Whether you're arriving by train or planning day trips, you'll appreciate the neighborhood's convenient connectivity.

As you stroll through the streets of Sants, you'll be greeted by a delightful mix of traditional Catalan architecture and modern developments. Quaint squares and narrow alleys are adorned with charming cafes, local boutiques, and family-run businesses. This creates a warm and inviting atmosphere that will make you feel right at home.

The Putxet i el Farró is a neighborhood belonging to the Sarrià-Sant Gervasi district, a residential area and thrives with prestigious schools, health centers surrounded by parks and gardens
Perched on the small mountain of the Putget, it's home to the beautiful park of the same name, created in 1970, and a beautiful garden inside, the Putget Gardens Turó that you can appreciate from the apartment's terrace.
It's an idyllic, quiet neighborhood with buildings of modernist architecture.
It is well connected by public transport, buses, FGC and easy access by car.
Near the apartment you will find shops with fresh products, supermarkets, the Mercat de Sant Gervasi, Mercat del Putxet, in Pl. de Joaquim Folguera, 6, in addition to banks, cafes and quality restaurants, and is next to the Barcino Tennis Club.

neighborhood_overview:
The Villa Olímpica neighborhood became a reference for quality and tranquility in Barcelona. Wide streets, such as Avenida de Icària or Avenida del Bogatell, fill with light and invite you to stroll. The Olympic Port and Nova Icària have opened up the seafront and have made Barcelona look at the sea again and enjoy it, and at the same time have become one of the hot spots for leisure in the city.

The Peix d'Or by the architect Frank Gehry, an impressive bronze sculpture that changes color with the hours of the day, recalls the maritime past of this neighborhood. A multitude of bars, beach bars, and restaurants meet under its scales, and this area has become one of the most vibrant leisure areas in Barcelona.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Poble Sec was the first extension built outside of Barcelona's historic city centre. Located at the base of Montjuïc, this neighbourhood has great access to all of the attractions on the hill, such as Poble Espanyol and many more museums. The main avenue of Poble Sec is Avinguda Paral·lel, which has been one of the principal areas for activities and leisure since the end of the 19th century. This avenue is home to much of Barcelona's nightlife with bars and clubs dotted along the street, including the popular Sala Apolo. This Barcelona 'Broadway', rich in performance history, is currently laced with numerous theatres including the Victoria Theatre and the Teatre Condal, and is situated close to La Ciutat del Teatre and the Barcelona Teatre Musical, a stage for numerous musicals and dance shows. You can also enjoy some delicious Spanish cuisine at some of the tapas bars and restaurants in Poble Sec, and don't miss a trip to Carrer Blai, where you can take in the live
host_about:
Hi everyone! We are AB Apartment Barcelona, a local agency that offers accommodation options for those that want to visit our wonderful city. Let us tell you a bit more about us :)

We have been managing apartments since 2007 when David and Dani, founders and twin brothers, decided to rent their holiday apartment, personally welcoming every guest and sharing with them their recommendations and advice about Barcelona.  

Today, we have many more apartments to rent in the city, whilst maintaining the essence of our beginnings. Our team is formed by local people and others from all round the world, that will help you with any doubts you may have, either before, during, or after your stay. 

Barcelona is our home, so we will be able to advise you on the best places to visit, from sights and attractions, to local bars and restaurants. You can also consult more expert advice on our Blog, awarded as one of the best tourism blogs in Barcelona.

By renting your apartment in Barcelona through us, you’ll be in safe hands :) We are looking forward to meeting you soon!

DURING YOUR STAY

We will be happy to help you with everything you need to make your stay an unforgettable experience! In addition, you will have access to our customer area, from which you can check-in online, report any problem if necessary, as well as book apartment services, activities, transfers and access local guides about Barcelona. We also have an office open 365 days a year and we have 24-hour telephone assistance for any emergency.

neighborhood_overview: Sarrià-Sant Gervasi has always been one of the most prosperous, exclusive, wealthy and historical districts in Barcelona. With it’s altitude, it uses the still-working Tramvia Blau; but part of the metro line 7 connecting with the foot of the Funicular del Tibidabo. SARRIÀ-SANT GERVASI’S most famous sight is Tibidabo, the highest peak of the Collserola mountains. In the same vein it is also home to the Tibidabo amusement park, the Sagrat Cor church and the Torre de Collserola television tower; designed by the British architect Sir Norman Foster to work as a symbol for the Olympics as well as it’s job as a television and radio streaming tower.  The district of Sarrià-Sant Gervasi is certainly very beautiful. This is due to the fact that it has always been home to the affluent classes of Barcelona. Subsequently, this means that many of the buildings and streets are very well maintained. You can also find some examples of the famous modernista architecture here; like in the Bellesguard wh

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the Barcelona neighborhood Eixample, in what has been called the "Quadrat d'Or". Its name is due to the many modernist buildings it houses, with Avenida Diagonal and Paseo de Gracia being the two most emblematic and prestigious streets in the neighborhood and in the city.

On streets very close to the accommodation there are bars, restaurants, art galleries and fashion shops highly recommended. It is one of the chic, trendy areas of the city, charming and far from the masification.
Local residents also frequent it.

Along Paseo de Gracia and the adjacent streets are Gaudí's architectural buildings and other prestigious 20th century architects. The most prestigious international firm stores are also located.

On Avenida Diagonal there are important and majestic buildings, some of them also modernists. Its spacious sidewalks allow you to take a walk and enjoy the beautiful views or sit on a terrace.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Les Corts, an enchanting district in the heart of Barcelona that offers a perfect blend of tradition, modernity, and a vibrant local atmosphere. From historic landmarks to bustling markets and serene parks, Les Corts beckons you to explore its treasures and experience the true essence of this captivating city.

Historical Gems:
Step back in time as you wander through the historic streets of Les Corts. Marvel at architectural wonders like the stunning Monastery of Pedralbes, a centuries-old masterpiece that whispers tales of the past. Immerse yourself in the rich heritage that's seamlessly intertwined with the contemporary urban landscape.

Shopping Delight:
Shopaholics, rejoice! Les Corts boasts an array of shopping options that cater to every taste. Whether you're seeking high-end fashion boutiques or local artisanal markets, you'll find your retail haven here. Don't miss the opportunity to explore L'Illa Diagonal, a stylish shopping center th

neighborhood_overview:
My apartment is in the Eixample barium. El Eixample (El Ensanche in Spanish) is the most populous neighborhood in Barcelona. It was born in the mid-19th century due to the increase in population and the need for expansion of the city. In this neighborhood of wide streets and tree-lined sidewalks are some of the most representative monuments of Barcelona, including the Sagrada Familia, Pedrera and Casa Batllò, three iconic buildings by architect Antoni Gaudí.

You will also find important avenues such as the Gran Vía or the famous Paseo de Gracia, Plaza Cataluña, one of the best-known squares or the Rambla de Catalunya El Eixample stands out above all for its architecture, as that is where most of the modernist monuments of the city are concentrated. You'll be constantly surprised by the characteristics of their buildings, so we recommend paying attention to their details.

Also in this neighborhood there are many bars and clubs, so nightlife is very lively in this a

name: Apartamento en carrer Blai, Poble Sec
description:
Modern apartment on an old estate in the lively Poble Sec neighborhood. It's a fifth without an elevator, but it makes up for how central and comfortable it is.
It is very close to the Metro and buses but you can walk to many of the most interesting places in the city.
The apartment has 2 bedrooms, kitchen with fridge and dishwasher and 2 bathrooms with shower, toiletries and washing machine. Towels and bedding are provided. Air conditioning, balcony and free WiFi.
neighborhood_overview:
The popular neighborhood of Poble Sec is a lively place from a cultural, friendly, and gastronomic point of view.
As you enter its narrow and colorful streets, you feel the essence of an authentic Barcelona.
Precisely, Carrer Blai, is the epicenter of the tapas in Poble Sec. This street is full of terraces, tavernas, tastings and restaurants.
We recommend making tapas in the "Blai Tonight" (C/Blai 23) with interesting pincho assortment at cheap prices.
Another option is to go to the "Koska taverna", a local cozy with original tapas (C/ Blai 8). Good vermouth, wine and cider.
And next door, "La bota", great for its tapas and vermuts.

name: Spacious 3bd/2bth Apartment in Gracia
neighborhood_overview:
Gracia used to be a separate town on the edge of Barcelona until it was absorbed by its larger neighbour. It is renowned for the fact that it has always managed to maintain an independent character from the rest of the city.
The neighbourhood is richly cultural, from the diversity of people walking its streets to street parties, human towers, live music and fireworks, a wide variety of restaurants, and cinemas, theatres and galleries. The unique architecture also adds a charm of its own.
The narrow streets, little squares and small buildings are reminiscent of the town it used to be, but the spectrum of restaurants, bars, shops and cinemas betray its status as a part of Barcelona, Catalunya’s capital city. Gracia offers the choice of quiet sleepy side streets alongside the life and bustle of its squares.

neighborhood_overview: El Born – you'll be at the heart of Barcelona's vibrant scene, right in the historic Old Town (Ciutat Vella), where El Born is almost touching Arc de Triomf and Park Ciutatella. The flat is just minutes from iconic spots like Santa Maria del Mar Church, the Picasso Museum, MOCO Art Museum, and the renowned cocktail bar "Paradiso." Barceloneta Beach is an 14-minute walk away, Ciutadella Park and the Old Port (Port Vell) are just 5 minutes, and Plaza Catalunya is 15 minutes on foot. You'll also find plenty of healthy dining options nearby, along with great tapas bars like El Diset and Tapeo.

neighborhood_overview:
Les Corts is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood located in the Les Corts district of Barcelona, Spain. Known for its residential character, Les Corts offers a blend of historic narrow streets and modern avenues, creating a lively and varied atmosphere.

The neighborhood is home to the iconic FC Barcelona stadium, Camp Nou, which serves as a major landmark for football fans and tourists alike. Additionally, Les Corts boasts a wide range of shops, restaurants, cafes, and bars that reflect the city's cultural diversity.

Les Corts also features green spaces such as Parc de Cervantes and Jardí de Can Mantega, providing residents and visitors with opportunities for relaxation and outdoor enjoyment. Moreover, the area benefits from excellent public transportation connections, facilitating access to other parts of the city.

neighborhood_overview:
Exploring Barcelona's hidden gems, the Hospital de Sant Pau, is an absolute must for any Art Nouveau enthusiast. Nestled away from the bustling tourist paths, this architectural masterpiece boasts not only stunning Art Nouveau design but also meticulously manicured gardens and captivating permanent exhibitions. You'll find Hospital de Sant Pau at 167 Sant Antoni Maria Claret street.

Immerse yourself in this charming residential neighborhood, replete with cozy cafes, unique shops, and delectable restaurants. Here are some personal recommendations:

Toca Teca Restaurant - A delightful spot for savoring authentic tapas.
Manà Restaurant - A culinary haven offering diverse cuisine.
Restaurant Art i Tapes Barcelona - A fusion of art and gastronomy.
Restaurante La Llama - An inviting dining experience.
Restaurante Santuxo - Satisfy your palate with their specialties.
NANA restaurante - brasa // Charcoal Grill - A grill-lover's paradise.

description:
In the heart of Barcelona, in Paseo de Gracia, you will find this newly renovated apartment that has two bedrooms and a large bathroom with all the luxuries and amenities you may need.
Located in the same Paseo de Gracia, it will go out on the balcony and be in the middle of the most emblematic street of Barcelona, 100m from Gaudí's Casa Batlló and 150m from the Plaza de Catalunya, the best connected point by public transport in the city, where it will be easy and convenient to reach anywhere.
neighborhood_overview: Barcelona's Eixample, and in particular Paseo de Gracia, is an avenue that epitomizes the elegance and splendor of the city. With its famous modernist architecture, such as Casa Batlló and La Pedrera de Gaudí, this boulevard is an outdoor museum. Its wide sidewalks and luxurious boutiques attract fashion and culture lovers. World-class restaurants, luxury hotels, and a vibrant nightlife make this area an epicenter of sophistication. Efficient transportation connections and a cosmopolitan atmosphere make Paseo de Gracia an exceptional place in the heart of Barcelona.

description:
Enjoy this newly renovated 2-bedroom apartment in the center of Barcelona, in a SAFE street. The apartment comes with two queen size beds, a cute balcony, a smart TV, a walk-in rain shower, smoke detectors, an air fryer, and a dishwasher.

It takes just a 3-minute walk to the nearest metro station and central bus lines. The beach is just 10 minutes away from this beautiful apartment.

Contact me now for more information about the location, activities, and other inquiries. I'm here to help :)
neighborhood_overview:
✔️ LOCATED IN A QUIET & SAFE STREET
The apartment is located in a save street with no shops or restaurants, what makes it pretty quiet at night. It’s the perfect location, because it’s very centered.

Barcelona is a ‘big’ city for European standards, so you should always be aware and take care of your belongings. You will love the location of my apartment, I’m sure!

Besides that, the apartment is only 200m away from two big streets, with different bus- and meteor stops. I think my street is the most quiet streets I know in the city center of Barcelona.

If you have any questions about this, please let me know. I am more than happy to clarify things for you and explain you more about the city and the neighborhood 😊

Born in The Netherlands, living in Barcelona. Currently traveling the world to make YouTube videos and enjoying my digital nomad life ☀️

name: Blueground | La Dreta de l'Eixample, furnished
description: Discover the best of Barcelona, with this two bedroom apartment in La Dreta de l'Eixample. with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this elegantly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, charming living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BCN112)
neighborhood_overview:
This busy district in central Barcelona is characterized by wide streets and an elegant atmosphere. L'Eixample is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, including buildings by Antoni Gaudí, and the shopping and dining around the Plaça de Catalunya and along Passeig de Gracia.

This neighborhood is renowned for its upscale shopping and dining, including international boutiques and upmarket restaurants on the Passeig de Gràcia and Rambla de Catalunya. Dreta de l’Eixample is also home to La Sagrada Familia, the iconic (and unfinished) masterwork from architect Antoni Gaudí.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Poblesec
description: A flat full of personality and with a unique energy, like the neighbourhood that houses it and gives it its name, Poble Sec.
host_about:
Somos unos apasionados de los viajes. Tanto, que ¡nos hemos convertido en profesionales! 

Estamos muy orgullosos de haber empezado alquilando apartamentos en Barcelona a viajeros nacionales e internacionales. Llevamos más de una década alquilando apartamentos a familias, grupos de amigos, parejas... y realmente siempre ha sido una experiencia muy gratificante para nosotros. Cuando viajamos con nuestros niños, o cuando podemos escaparnos un fin de semana solos, es la opción de alojamiento que más nos gusta. Tenemos independencia, comodidad, conocemos muchos anfitriones nos enriquecen con sus historias y consejos sobre la ciudad y vivimos la ciudad casi casi como un local más.

Nos gusta sentirnos a gusto cuando viajamos, por eso es lo que intentamos ofrecer siempre a nuestros huéspedes. Tenemos un pequeño equipo que nos ayuda para lograr una mejor atención y que se esfuerza por hacer de la experiencia lo mejor posible. 

Esperamos verte pronto! Y no dudes en contactarnos para lo que necesites. 

Lodging Team

neighborhood_overview:
The Gothic Quarter (Catalan: Barri Gòtic or El Gòtic, Spanish: Barrio Gótico) is the historic centre of the old city of Barcelona. The quarter encompasses the oldest parts of the city of Barcelona, and includes the remains of the city's Roman wall and several notable medieval landmarks.

The Barrio Gótico retains a labyrinthine street plan, with many small streets opening out into squares.

Some of the best points of interest or monuments of the Gothic Quarter are The Royal Plaza (Catalan: Plaça Reial), The Cathedral of Barcelona (Catalan: Catedral de Barcelona), The Basilica of Santa Maria del Pi (Catalan: Basílica de Santa María del Pi), Sant Jaume Square (Catalan: Plaça de Sant Jaume) and The Old Port (Catalan: Port Vell).

name: Room in Sants-Montjuïc BE20740003
neighborhood_overview:
Sants-Montjuïc is a quiet and well-connected neighborhood in Barcelona. Located to the southwest of the city center, this neighborhood is known for its relaxed atmosphere and easy access to various attractions and amenities. In Sants-Montjuïc, you'll find a mix of residential areas, green parks, and a wide range of conveniences.

One of the highlights of this neighborhood is its excellent public transportation connection. Sants Train Station is one of the city's main transportation hubs and provides access to commuter, regional, and long-distance trains, making it easy to travel within Catalonia, Spain, and Europe. Additionally, the neighborhood boasts several metro stations and bus stops, making it straightforward to get around the city.

Sants-Montjuïc also houses popular attractions such as Montjuïc Park, which offers beautiful gardens, museums, and panoramic views of Barcelona. Furthermore, the neighborhood features a variety of local shops, restaurants, and bar

neighborhood_overview: The Eixample (Ensanche) district of Barcelona was built in the 19th century. It is the birthplace of Antoni Gaudí's modernist art movement, which is his main reference. In this area are the impressive Sagrada Familia, the famous "La Pedrera", Gaudí's work, as well as the Manzana de la Discordia, the Hospital de la Santa Creu and Sant Pau, etc. A large part of the attraction of the Eixample is the mythical Passeig de Gràcia Avenue, one of the most famous avenues in Spain for its importance for shopping, business and a large showcase of outstanding works of Modernist architecture, which is compared to the Champs Elysees in Paris or the Fifth Avenue in New York. This area is full of great modernist works, such as the Casa Batlló de Gaudí, the Casa de Puig i Cadafalch Amatller and Lleó Morera de Domènech i Muntaner known as the Apple of Discord. Also in this area is the University of Barcelona, which is an elegant building with beautiful gardens and Casa Gofverichs Boada. House built by on

host_about:
The Onsider Barcelona serviced apartments are a new stylish and luxury residences concept located in the trendiest neighbourhoods of Barcelona. In a world where mobility has become a way of living, and connection a way of being, The Onsider is a building that has been created to fill a gap between the traditional hospitality industry and the expanding demand on Extended-Stay Luxury Serviced Residences. 

Contemporary and cosy, these unique apartments feature a range of comfortable and luxurious modern suites, as well as an outstanding and dedicated guest relations service. Endowed by the interior designer Jaime Beriestain, The Onsider Barcelona recreates Barcelona’s cosmopolitan lifestyle in a sophisticated and elegant way, in which commitment to the environment is a must.

neighborhood_overview: Literally meaning ‘expansion,’ the elegant and central Eixample district of Barcelona is a veritable showcase of architectural Modernista masterpieces (Gaudi’s La Sagrada Familia, Casa Mila, and Casa Batllo; Casa Lleo Morera; Casa Amatller), upscale boutiques, great dining, and wild nightlife. The heart of the buzzing gay club scene is here -- its nickname is even ‘Gaixample’ -- but it has a more laid-back atmosphere than San Francisco’s Castro. You’ll find lively nightlife here, from trendy hipster bars to gilded lounges. Defined by its tree-lined boulevards and Romanesque buildings, the area is full of bustling markets, friendly locals and a wealth of famous attractions, including La Pedrera, the Fundacio Antoni Tapies, the Egipci Museum, and the Sala Foundation. If you’re looking to explore Barcelona’s architecture, elegant dining, and nightlife scene, this is the perfect location. El Prat Airport: 20 minutes by car without traffic or 50 minutes by public transit Sants Station: 15 m

name: AB Casa Saltor One
description: This apartment is located in the centre of Barcelona, near to the bustling Plaça Catalunya and Plaça Espanya. Located in the Eixample neighbourhood of Barcelona, this area is home to a number of fantastic bars, cafés and restaurants. You will find many areas of Barcelona are within walking distance to this apartment, however it is also well connected to other places in and around the city by public transport, including train, bus and metro.
neighborhood_overview: Eixample is Catalan for 'extension', meaning an extension of the old Barcelona city. Eixample was designed by Catalan-born urban planning visionary, Ildefons Cerdà, who took traffic and sunlight (amongst many other things) into consideration when creating the plans for this new district. Eixample is now characterised by its octagonal blocks and its grid-like pattern, with wide streets and both commercial and residential areas. It is split into two parts, Eixample Esquerra (Left, or in Spanish, Izquierdo) and Eixample Dret (Right, or in Spanish, Derecho), both of which are home to some fantastic restaurants and stores. Eixample Izquierdo is delimited by the grand, Passeig de Gràcia, a paradise for shopping and dining, and Plaça d'Espanya, where the Montjuïc Magic Fountain and one of the biggest convention centres in Barcelona can be found. The Parc de Joan Miró, with its iconic 'Woman and Bird' sculpture created by the Barcelona-born artist, is also situated here, as well as the Arenas
host_about:
Hi everyone! We are AB Apartment Barcelona, a local agency that offers accommodation options for those that want to visit our wonderful city. Let us tell you a bit more about us :)

We have been managing apartments since 2007 when David and Dani, founders and twin brothers, decided to rent their holiday apartment, personally welcoming every guest and sharing with them their recommendations and advice about Barcelona.  

Today, we have many more apartments to rent in the city, whilst maintaining the essence of our beginnings. Our team is formed by local people and others from all round the world, that will help you with any doubts you may have, either before, during, or after your stay. 

Barcelona is our home, so we will be able to advise you on the best places to visit, from sights and attractions, to local bars and restaurants. You can also consult more expert advice on our Blog, awarded as one of the best tourism blogs in Barcelona.

By renting your apartment in Barcelona through us, you’ll be in safe hands :) We are looking forward to meeting you soon!

DURING YOUR STAY

We will be happy to help you with everything you need to make your stay an unforgettable experience! In addition, you will have access to our customer area, from which you can check-in online, report any problem if necessary, as well as book apartment services, activities, transfers and access local guides about Barcelona. We also have an office open 365 days a year and we have 24-hour telephone assistance for any emergency.

neighborhood_overview: An ideal blend of city and country, the Sarrià-Sant Gervasi district straddles the city grid and the slopes of Mt. Tibidabo. The southern portion of the district is home to world-class shopping and dining, with everything from sushi to tapas bars on offer and both independent and brand-name boutiques. The more rural portion of Sarrià-Sant Gervasi includes highlights such as the Vallvidrera Reservoir, a perfect place for a long walk in nature, and the Parque de Atracciones, accessible via a funicular railway.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the elegant Eixample neighborhood, known for its iconic grid layout, stunning modernist architecture, and vibrant cultural scene. This central area is safe, walkable, and packed with cafes, boutiques, and landmarks.

Walking Distances to Key Attractions:
PASEO DE GRACIA: 3 minutes – Luxury shopping, Gaudi's Casa Batlló & La Pedrera.
GAUDI’S HOUSES: 5 minutes – Casa Batlló and La Pedrera.
PLAZA CATALUNYA: 10 minutes – Heart of the city and gateway to Las Ramblas.
LAS RAMBLAS: 12 minutes – Iconic pedestrian street with shops and restaurants.
SAGRADA FAMILIA: 15 minutes – Gaudi’s masterpiece.
Enjoy the perfect blend of modern comfort and unbeatable proximity to Barcelona’s most famous sights!

name: Luminous 2-bedroom in Gràcia
description:
Temporary rental exclusively for leisure, vacation, recreational or cultural purposes.

Incredible opportunity in the vibrant neighborhood of Gràcia! This bright and spacious recently renovated two-bedroom apartment offers all the comfort you need for an unforgettable stay in Barcelona, a true home away from home during your time in the city.
neighborhood_overview: Gracia area is popular with artists and a generally bohemian crowd, it also has a high ethnic population and the highest concentration of foreign restaurants in Barcelona. Plaça de Sol is the most renowned area of the neighbourhood, it's lined with terrace cafes and at night this is where the people convene to drink and be merry. However despite the trendy nature of Gràcia it is also a traditional barrio with a large elderly population which makes for an amusing and odd mix - and entertaining people-watching.

name: Blueground | Sarrià, doorman, fresh renovation
neighborhood_overview: An ideal blend of city and country, the Sarrià-Sant Gervasi district straddles the city grid and the slopes of Mt. Tibidabo. The southern portion of the district is home to world-class shopping and dining, with everything from sushi to tapas bars on offer and both independent and brand-name boutiques. The more rural portion of Sarrià-Sant Gervasi includes highlights such as the Vallvidrera Reservoir, a perfect place for a long walk in nature, and the Parque de Atracciones, accessible via a funicular railway.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Immerse yourself in Barcelona's Eixample district, where youthful energy merges with architectural majesty. The expansive avenues and plazas in this neighborhood offer the perfect setting for students or travelers looking for a balance between history and modernity.

From the Eixample, you can admire Gaudí's iconic works, such as the Sagrada Familia and Casa Batlló, inspiring you with their creativity as you head to your classes. Paseo de Gracia, with its designer shops, is an ideal place to find that perfect outfit for your academic days and fun nights.

Local cafes and restaurants offer you an authentic Catalan gastronomic experience, perfect for sharing with friends and compis. The lively squares and nearby parks provide spaces to study outdoors or just relax.

The proximity to Plaza Cataluña and the bustling old town keeps you connected to the city's city life and cultural events. Eixample is the ideal blend of student atmosphere and cultural explorati

neighborhood_overview:
Ciutat Vella, which translates to "Old City" in Catalan, is one of Barcelona's oldest and most historic districts. It is located in the heart of the city. It encompasses the area where Barcelona was founded by the Romans over 2,000 years ago.

Ciutat Vella is characterized by its narrow medieval streets, historic buildings, and many cultural and architectural landmarks. The district is divided into several neighbourhoods, each with unique charm and attractions.

Some of the notable neighbourhoods within Ciutat Vella include:

Barri Gòtic (Gothic Quarter): This is the oldest part of Barcelona, featuring narrow cobblestone streets, medieval buildings, and significant historical sites such as the Barcelona Cathedral, Plaça Sant Jaume, and the Jewish Quarter.

El Raval: Once a notorious area, El Raval has undergone a significant transformation recently and is now a diverse and multicultural neighbourhood. It is known for its vibrant arts scen

name: Blueground | La Dreta de l'Eixample, balcony
description: Discover the best of Barcelona, with this two bedroom apartment in La Dreta de l'Eixample. with balcony views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this fashionably Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BCN130)
neighborhood_overview:
This busy district in central Barcelona is characterized by wide streets and an elegant atmosphere. L'Eixample is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, including buildings by Antoni Gaudí, and the shopping and dining around the Plaça de Catalunya and along Passeig de Gracia.

This neighborhood is renowned for its upscale shopping and dining, including international boutiques and upmarket restaurants on the Passeig de Gràcia and Rambla de Catalunya. Dreta de l’Eixample is also home to La Sagrada Familia, the iconic (and unfinished) masterwork from architect Antoni Gaudí.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Cozy apt on La Rambla de Catalunya
description:
Modern decoration
Central location
For 2 persons

Welcome to our apartment on the central Rambla de Catalunya! Perfect for a couple's trip or a business stay.

This apartment has a room with a double bed to provide comfort for 2 travelers.
host_about:
Hi there,

My name is Enrique and I am a Barcelona Local. I have always loved traveling myself, but also sharing the beauty and wonders of Barcelona with others, so a few years ago I started renting out 2 apartments to travelers coming to the city, always meeting everyone in person so I could share my insights and hidden secrets about Barcelona :)

Now I rent out a few more apartments and it is no longer just me, but we are a small team of people managing the apartments together, but with the same focus on personal and attentive services in authentic apartments that allow for the genuine Barcelona feel for your trip! We call our little team Stay U-nique, because of this focus on a unique feeling when staying with us.

If you have any questions, want to hear about an apartment or just say hi, don´t hesitate to reach out :)

Have a great day!
Enrique

neighborhood_overview:
The Eixample district not only is the most iconic in Barcelona, it’s also the most diverse in terms of shopping, restaurants and nightlife. The gridlike layout is the symbol of the sunny and modern Barcelona we know today.
Nowadays Eixample is famous for being home to the majority of Barcelona's Art Nouveau masterpieces, and a high-class residential and shopping area. The Eixample is one of the most dynamic and comfortable areas to live in Barcelona, mainly because there’s always a restaurant, shop, supermarket or bar at walking distance.

name: Romantic in Trendy Gracia
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located on a street that is in the Gràcia neighbourhood, a popular and lively area of Barcelona. This street is centrally located, making it convenient for those who want to explore the city and enjoy all it has to offer.

Gràcia's history dates back to the 17th century, when it became an independent village. In 1897, Gràcia became part of Barcelona and today it is known for its bohemian atmosphere and narrow streets full of shops, bars and restaurants.

There are many tourist attractions close to the flat, including Park Güell, one of Barcelona's most famous parks and designed by the famous architect Antoni Gaudí. Also nearby is the famous La Pedrera building, another of Gaudi's many iconic buildings in Barcelona.

For those looking to sample local food, there are many typical bars and restaurants in the area, including La Botiga del Café, a cosy café serving delicious breakfasts and brunch, and La Pepita Burger Bar, a restaurant specialising

description: Beautiful apartment of 115 square meters in the area of Guinardó, Barcelona. The apartment is bathed in natural light as it faces the 4 winds. The building is quiet and family friendly, with only one house per floor, which guarantees privacy and tranquility.

name: Stylish 1BD Flat | Gracia District |  Sleeps 3!
description: Immerse yourself in the charm of my stylish 1-bedroom apartment, boasting both comfort and elegance. With superb transport connections just a 5-minute stroll from the nearest tube station, exploring Barcelona is a breeze. Step outside and discover the vibrant neighborhood, bustling with life and excitement. From trendy cafes to cultural hotspots, there's so much to explore just moments from your doorstep.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the vibrant heart of Barcelona in the trendy Gràcia neighborhood, where our charming apartment awaits. Experience the local charm with quaint cafes and enticing restaurants just steps away. Within a short 5 to 7-minute stroll, you'll find yourself on the iconic Paseo de Gracia, home to renowned landmarks and upscale boutiques.

Immerse yourself in the eclectic mix of shops, galleries, and markets that define Gràcia's unique character. Explore hidden plazas and leafy parks, escaping the city's hustle and bustle while soaking up the bohemian atmosphere.

From savoring tapas to admiring street art, Gràcia offers a rich cultural tapestry to explore. Your Barcelona adventure begins here.

name: Beautiful Double Room in Heart of Born, Barcelona
description: Discover your ideal retreat in the heart of Born, Barcelona. Nestled in a charming apartment, this double room offers comfort and convenience. Unwind on a cozy double bed after a day of exploration. Organize your belongings effortlessly with the spacious wardrobe. A dedicated desk provides a tranquil space for work or planning your adventures. Enjoy our fully equipped kitchen and freshen up in the shared bathroom. Embrace the vibrant atmosphere of Born just steps from your doorstep.
neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Born in Barcelona is a labyrinth of historical charm and vibrant modernity. Its narrow cobbled streets reveal trendy boutiques, cozy coffee shops and squares full of life. Dominated by the majestic Basílica de Santa Maria del Mar, this neighborhood is brimming with medieval history and Gothic architecture. But el Born is also a hive of contemporary creativity, with cutting-edge art galleries and alternatively designed stores. Its bars and restaurants offer an eclectic mix of Catalan and international cuisine. Immerse yourself in the unique atmosphere of Born, where the past merges with the present in an unforgettable experience.

Apart from the Born, you will be walking from the Gothic Quarter with the famous Cathedral of Barcelona and emblematic La Rabla, central Plaza Catalunya and on the other hand the port and beach of Barceloneta.

name: AB Sagrada Familia Views
description:
Set within the vibrant Eixample district lies this 3-bedroom apartment, an ideal option for families or groups seeking a comfortable city escape. With its convenient amenities and prime location, it promises an unforgettable stay in one of Barcelona´s most desirable neighbourhoods.

Relax in its living room, furnished with a comfortable sofa, TV, and dining table, offering the perfect space to unwind after a day of exploration.
neighborhood_overview: Eixample is Catalan for 'extension', meaning an extension of the old Barcelona city, and it is one of the most popular districts in the Catalan capital. Eixample was designed by Catalan-born architect, Ildefons Cerdà, who took traffic and sunlight (amongst many other things) into consideration when drawing up the plans of the new area. Eixample is now characterised by its octagonal blocks and its grid-like pattern, with wide streets and both commercial and residential areas. It is split into two parts, Eixample Esquerra (Left, or in Spanish, Izquierdo) and Eixample Dret (Right, or in Spanish, Derecho), and is home to one of the most famous streets in Barcelona, Passeig de Gràcia, known for its high fashion stores and trendy restaurants. The street is intersected by the long Avinguda Diagonal, which runs through the entire city. Eixample Derecho is home to many gems of 'Modernisme' architecture, including the unique Casa Milà (La Pedrera), the colourful Casa Batlló and the towering Sagr
host_about:
Hi everyone! We are AB Apartment Barcelona, a local agency that offers accommodation options for those that want to visit our wonderful city. Let us tell you a bit more about us :)

We have been managing apartments since 2007 when David and Dani, founders and twin brothers, decided to rent their holiday apartment, personally welcoming every guest and sharing with them their recommendations and advice about Barcelona.  

Today, we have many more apartments to rent in the city, whilst maintaining the essence of our beginnings. Our team is formed by local people and others from all round the world, that will help you with any doubts you may have, either before, during, or after your stay. 

Barcelona is our home, so we will be able to advise you on the best places to visit, from sights and attractions, to local bars and restaurants. You can also consult more expert advice on our Blog, awarded as one of the best tourism blogs in Barcelona.

By renting your apartment in Barcelona through us, you’ll be in safe hands :) We are looking forward to meeting you soon!

DURING YOUR STAY

We will be happy to help you with everything you need to make your stay an unforgettable experience! In addition, you will have access to our customer area, from which you can check-in online, report any problem if necessary, as well as book apartment services, activities, transfers and access local guides about Barcelona. We also have an office open 365 days a year and we have 24-hour telephone assistance for any emergency.

Experience Barcelona like a local from your home base.
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to El Clot, Barcelona: A Blend of Tradition and Modernity

Discover the authentic heart of Barcelona in El Clot, a vibrant neighborhood that seamlessly marries the old with the new. Nestled in the Sant Martí district, El Clot is a haven for those seeking an immersive local experience with all the conveniences of city life. Here are some of the best highlights you can enjoy during your stay:

Historic Charm and Local Culture
Parc del Clot: A beautifully designed urban park where ancient industrial structures blend with lush green spaces, perfect for a leisurely stroll or a relaxing afternoon.
Mercat del Clot: Dive into the local culture at this bustling market. Fresh produce, artisanal goods, and a variety of local delicacies make it a must-visit for food lovers.
El Clot-Aragó Railway Station: An architectural gem that also serves as a gateway to explore other parts of the city with ease.

neighborhood_overview: The district of El Putxet is located in the upper area of Barcelona. It is one of the districts inhabited by the upper class of Barcelona. El Putxet is a mountain situated between the districts of Vallcarca and Sant Gervasi. During the 19th century, it was a place where the inhabitants of Barcelona used to spend their summer. However, later on, due to the construction of better infrastructures, it became a residential zone of the upper class of the city. If you like exclusive districts, you might like to rent an apartment in el Putxet during your stay in Barcelona. This apartment is located really close to the famous park Guell (the jewel of Catalan Modernism) and to the district of Gracia (the cultural center of Barcelona).

description:
The charm of a studio that has it all in the desirable Gracia neighborhood will be the perfect place for your stay. Just a few steps away you will have restaurants, pharmacies, supermarkets and public transport at your disposal.

Let yourself be carried away by the magic of this area that has a great balance between residential and the good vibes of bars and restaurants that are found throughout its streets.
neighborhood_overview:
Entering the streets of Gracia is immersing yourself in the cultural and artistic life of Barcelona. Each corner invites you to stroll slowly and walk the entire length to end, through its narrow streets, in squares full of history and atmosphere.

description:
Important: The municipal tax is not included in the price.

This charming loft-style apartment is perfect for couples and the ideal retreat for a romantic getaway in Barcelona. With an open and bright design, the apartment is divided into two distinct areas: the daytime zone, which includes a cozy living-dining room and a modern kitchen, and the nighttime zone, where you’ll find the comfortable bedroom. A unique place to enjoy tranquility and comfort in the heart of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Calle Bismarck is located in the Gràcia neighborhood, a vibrant and very authentic area of the city, known for its bohemian atmosphere and traditional Catalan architecture. This neighborhood has a unique character, with narrow streets and lively squares, perfect for strolling and discovering independent shops, charming cafés, and local restaurants. It is an ideal area to experience the more local and less touristy side of Barcelona, with a great cultural and gastronomic offer.

From Calle Bismarck, you will be just a few minutes away from Parc Güell, one of the most iconic places in the city, designed by the famous architect Antoni Gaudí. In addition, the Vallcarca metro station is nearby, which will allow you to move easily around the city and access other important tourist areas, such as Eixample, La Sagrada Familia, or Passeig de Gràcia.

You will also be close to Plaza de la Vila de Gràcia, one of the most popular meeting points in the neighborhood, full of bars

name: Chic 22@ Flat, Near to the Beach
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located in the Sant Martí district, a quiet and well-connected residential area of Barcelona. The location is convenient for those looking for accommodation close to the city centre without being in the tourist hustle and bustle.

As for the history of the area, Joan d'Austria was the nephew of Charles V and one of the main generals of Philip II. In 1571, he led the Spanish fleet to victory over the Turks at the Battle of Lepanto. The street named after him was built in the 1970s as part of the urban renewal of the area.

Nearby tourist attractions include the Agbar Tower, an impressive glass and steel structure designed by Jean Nouvel, and the Sagrada Familia, Antoni Gaudí's unfinished masterpiece. There are also several museums nearby, including the Design Museum and the Museum of the History of Catalonia.

For those looking to enjoy the local gastronomy, we recommend visiting some of the typical restaurants in the area, such as Casa Paloma,

neighborhood_overview:
This busy district in central Barcelona is characterized by wide streets and an elegant atmosphere. L'Eixample is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, including buildings by Antoni Gaudí, and the shopping and dining around the Plaça de Catalunya and along Passeig de Gracia.
L'Antiga Esquerra de l'Eixample is the setting for Barcelona University, so the neighborhood is filled with young people, as well as bars, cafes, and restaurants geared toward students. Other highlights include the Mercat del Ninot, which has a variety of food vendors, and several theaters.

name: Barcelona Center Apt: Rooftop Pool for 8
description: 3 bedrooms apartment with pool and terrace, close to Ciutadella Park in Barcelona. (Eixample, Barcelona, Spain)
neighborhood_overview:
The location of this apartment is excellent: a short walk from the famous Arc de Triomf and the Parc de la Ciutadella (a really nice park very popular among young people and families). Plaça de Catalunya (the main square in Barcelona) and its variety of bars, restaurants and shops is really close to the apartment too. Visit the Barri Gòtic (the gothic town) with its quaint narrow streets and street artists.

Do not forget to visit the Born, one of the three districts of Ciutat Vella. Walk along its streets full of shops, small cafes and restaurants with delicious tapas. Visit the Picasso Museum and the Chocolate Museum, or take a walk along the Passeig Joan Borbó down to la Barceloneta.

Really close to the Metro station Arc de Triomf (L1).

name: Boqueria Rambla 32
host_about:
Somos unos apasionados de los viajes. Tanto, que ¡nos hemos convertido en profesionales! 

Estamos muy orgullosos de haber empezado alquilando apartamentos en Barcelona a viajeros nacionales e internacionales. Llevamos más de una década alquilando apartamentos a familias, grupos de amigos, parejas... y realmente siempre ha sido una experiencia muy gratificante para nosotros. Cuando viajamos con nuestros niños, o cuando podemos escaparnos un fin de semana solos, es la opción de alojamiento que más nos gusta. Tenemos independencia, comodidad, conocemos muchos anfitriones nos enriquecen con sus historias y consejos sobre la ciudad y vivimos la ciudad casi casi como un local más.

Nos gusta sentirnos a gusto cuando viajamos, por eso es lo que intentamos ofrecer siempre a nuestros huéspedes. Tenemos un pequeño equipo que nos ayuda para lograr una mejor atención y que se esfuerza por hacer de la experiencia lo mejor posible. 

Esperamos verte pronto! Y no dudes en contactarnos para lo que necesites. 

Lodging Team

neighborhood_overview:
Barrio Gòtico is a captivating labyrinth of narrow medieval streets, historic squares and architectural treasures located in the heart of Barcelona. As one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city, it has a rich tapestry of history, culture, and charm, making it a must-see destination.

Beyond its historical charm, Barri Gòtic is a vibrant center of gastronomy and culture. You can enjoy authentic Catalan cuisine in traditional tapas tavernas and bars, drink sangría in sun bathed squares or immerse yourself in the local art scene in galleries and theaters scattered throughout the neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood around Via Laietana, between the Gothic and the Born, is one of the most vibrant and charming neighborhoods in Barcelona. It mixes history and modernity, with narrow streets, medieval squares and gothic buildings. Here you will find monuments such as the Cathedral and Palau de la Música, along with boutique shops, tapas bars and restaurants. El Born offers a bohemian and artistic atmosphere, while the Gothic is the historical soul of the city, full of culture and life.

name: Sultan - 2 bedrooms and terrace in Eixample Dreta
neighborhood_overview:
Eixample Dreta is a sophisticated neighborhood in Eixample district in Barcelona characterized by its modernist architecture and a thriving urban lifestyle. Primarily residential, it offers a balance of tranquility and city convenience, making it ideal for those seeking rent flats Eixample Dreta.

Famous for its iconic Gaudi buildings, including Casa Batlló and La Pedrera, Eixample Dreta is a cultural hub. Enjoy a leisurely stroll along Passeig de Gràcia, a renowned shopping avenue, or indulge in delicious tapas at Bar Pinotxo or contemporary cuisine at Tickets.

Well-connected with Diagonal and Passeig de Gràcia metro stations, the area offers easy access to the city. Stay fit at the upscale Holmes Place gym or enjoy a coffee at Camelia Art Café. For those seeking flexible workspaces, the neighborhood boasts several co-working spaces, including Atico.
host_about: At Ukio, we've redefined the concept of living and working abroad. We offer fully-furnished, designer apartments for mid-to-long-term stays in Europe's most vibrant cities, combining comfort, flexibility, and premium service.

It stands out for its modernist architecture, with iconic buildings such as Casa Batlló and La Pedrera by Gaudí. It is a stylish area with wide avenues, luxury shops, restaurants, and cafes. Its central location and vibrant atmosphere make it one of the city's most attractive and busy neighborhoods.

The infrastructure is excellent.

description: Equipped double room with two single beds, air conditioning, high speed Wi-Fi, spacious closet and desk to work. study or plan your trips. The home features two shared bathrooms and a fully equipped shared kitchen, perfect for preparing your own meals and enjoying a homey atmosphere.
neighborhood_overview: Barcelona's Gothic Quarter, close to Plaza Catalunya, is one of the city's oldest and most emblematic spots. With its narrow medieval streets, charming squares and Gothic architecture, it offers an atmosphere full of history and charm. In this area you will find a variety of bars, restaurants, boutiques, and unique shops, as well as monuments such as the Cathedral of Barcelona. Its central location allows easy access to other tourist spots, and its lively day and night life makes it ideal for living or visiting.

neighborhood_overview: El Poblenou is a vast district with hip cafes and tapa bars along Rambla de Poblenou boulevard, as well as converted factories housing tech offices and design showrooms. Sights around Plaça de les Glòries Catalanes include Els Encants flea market, the futuristic Barcelona Design Museum and the Torre Agbar skyscraper, designed by Jean Nouvel. Dotted with ice cream vendors, Bogatell Beach is a popular spot for volleyball.
host_about: At GuestReady, we're on a mission to redefine modern hospitality. We specialise in helping hosts deliver outstanding experiences to their guests worldwide. host_about:
At Badi, we believe that finding a new home should be an exciting and enjoyable experience. That's why we've made it our mission to make the process of finding a mid-term rental as easy and stress-free as possible. Our company offers a wide variety of options, from private rooms to entire apartments, that cater to all types of travelers. Whether you're a student, professional, or simply on a long-term vacation, we've got you covered.

We understand that moving to a new city can be daunting, which is why we've made sure to include all the necessary amenities and services to make your transition as smooth as possible. From fully furnished properties to all-inclusive pricing, we take care of all the details so you can focus on what really matters. Our properties are carefully curated and inspected to ensure they meet our high standards of quality and comfort.

We pride ourselves on our commitment to trust and transparency. Our platform is designed to make it easy for you to find the perfect accommodation and to book it with confidence. From 24/7 customer support to verified reviews, we've got your back every step of the way.

neighborhood_overview: The Esquerra de l’Eixample, or Left of Extension in Catalan, is separated into two sections: old and modern, which is where Entença is located. The style of Old Left Eixample is largely Neo-Romanesque, and visitors are encouraged to take a stroll through the neighborhood to observe the wonderful architecture. The Universitat de Barcelona and the Plaça de la Universitat, both of which are only a few minutes’ walk from the flat, are good instances of this. They will also come across The Mercat de Sant Antoni, the Ninot, where they may purchase some goods. New Left Eixample was built in the 1930s and is more of a Monderisme style. Close by are the Casa Batlló, the Escola Industrial, the Modelo Prison, and the Escorxador Slaughterhouses. These structures, on the other hand, were built before the neighborhood was even conceived.
host_about:
Quim here!

I love welcoming guests from all over the world to stay and enjoy the sights and sounds of Barcelona, a dynamic and growing city, in one of my lovely apartments.
Learn the neighborhoods, what Barcelona has to offer, fall in love with the city, explore the busy streets, wind down the narrow streets, find hidden gems, and make memories with friends and families. 

I am working together with a professional team of people managing the apartments, available 24/7 during your stay and with the same focus on personal and attentive services. All my apartments are in Eixample district, an ideal spot for culture and gastronomy lovers, the perfect area to explore the city and enjoy from the catalan atmosphere. 

Do not hesitate to message me for any question :)
Looking forward to host you!

name: AB Les Corts V
description:
Located in the vibrant Les Corts neighbourhood lies this 2-bedroom apartment. With WiFi and air conditioning throughout, your comfort is assured year-round.

Relax in its living room, furnished with a sofa, TV, and dining table, providing the perfect space to unwind aftre a day of exploring.

The kitchen is fully equipped with essential appliances and tools, making meal preparation easy and convenient.
neighborhood_overview: Les Corts is a quiet district situated in the northeast of Barcelona. The area is mainly residential, although there are numerous office buildings and prestigious education centres to be found here, too. On Avinguda Diagonal, one of the main commercial veins of Barcelona, you will find plenty of bars, restaurants and places to shop, including the complexes, L'Illa Diagonal and El Corte Inglés. One of the biggest attractions of Les Corts is the Camp Nou, home to FC Barcelona. This massive stadium is a must-see when in Barcelona, whether you decide to head to an exciting match during the football season or take a tour of the Museu del Barça, the most visited museum in the city. If you're looking to stay away from the bustling city centre, but remain just a short metro ride from all the sights of Barcelona, then an apartment in Les Corts is ideal for you.

neighborhood_overview:
This busy district in central Barcelona is characterized by wide streets and an elegant atmosphere. L'Eixample is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, including buildings by Antoni Gaudí, and the shopping and dining around the Plaça de Catalunya and along Passeig de Gracia.
Sagrada Família is a prized Barcelona neighborhood that is the site of Antoni Gaudí’s renowned basilica of the same name and the adjacent Plaça de Gaudí. This upscale area is home to a number of hotels and restaurants, including both Catalan fare and international options.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description:
This 2 bedroom apartment is located in Poble Sec, which places you close to the incredible Montjuïc. With WiFi connection and air conditioning, it is the perfect place to stay in the city of Barcelona.
The living room has a sofa, TV, and a dining table, making it a lovely space to relax after a long journey. Additionally, from here you have access to the balcony, which lets natural light into the room.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Poble Sec was the first extension built outside of Barcelona's historic city centre. Located at the base of Montjuïc, this neighbourhood has great access to all of the attractions on the hill, such as Poble Espanyol and many more museums. The main avenue of Poble Sec is Avinguda Paral·lel, which has been one of the principal areas for activities and leisure since the end of the 19th century. This avenue is home to much of Barcelona's nightlife with bars and clubs dotted along the street, including the popular Sala Apolo. This Barcelona 'Broadway', rich in performance history, is currently laced with numerous theatres including the Victoria Theatre and the Teatre Condal, and is situated close to La Ciutat del Teatre and the Barcelona Teatre Musical, a stage for numerous musicals and dance shows. You can also enjoy some delicious Spanish cuisine at some of the tapas bars and restaurants in Poble Sec, and don't miss a trip to Carrer Blai, where you can take in the live
host_about:
Hi everyone! We are AB Apartment Barcelona, a local agency that offers accommodation options for those that want to visit our wonderful city. Let us tell you a bit more about us :)

We have been managing apartments since 2007 when David and Dani, founders and twin brothers, decided to rent their holiday apartment, personally welcoming every guest and sharing with them their recommendations and advice about Barcelona.  

Today, we have many more apartments to rent in the city, whilst maintaining the essence of our beginnings. Our team is formed by local people and others from all round the world, that will help you with any doubts you may have, either before, during, or after your stay. 

Barcelona is our home, so we will be able to advise you on the best places to visit, from sights and attractions, to local bars and restaurants. You can also consult more expert advice on our Blog, awarded as one of the best tourism blogs in Barcelona.

By renting your apartment in Barcelona through us, you’ll be in safe hands :) We are looking forward to meeting you soon!

DURING YOUR STAY

We will be happy to help you with everything you need to make your stay an unforgettable experience! In addition, you will have access to our customer area, from which you can check-in online, report any problem if necessary, as well as book apartment services, activities, transfers and access local guides about Barcelona. We also have an office open 365 days a year and we have 24-hour telephone assistance for any emergency.

name: Charming, Stylish, cozy loft with Terrace
description: Lovely loft located in a very dynamic district of the city. This apartment will offer you a stylish and cozy stay in the center of Barcelona. (Gràcia, Barcelona, Spain)
neighborhood_overview:
Gràcia is a district in Barcelona which gathers the charm of tradition with the freshness of modernity. It was once an independent town. However, nowadays, it is the core of a district that includes other neighbourhoods such as Vallcarca Pentitents or Salut. All this area is very popular for its nightlife. You can also find a great number of boutiques and a variety of bars and restaurants.

The district of Gràcia is home to many students. There is as well a community of artists, actors, musicians, photographers and designers. They all contribute to the “bohemian” environment which is characteristic of the place. You can easily access the most emblematic places of the city from here (the Casa Fuster, Parc Guell, Casa Vicens, Paseo de Gracia, Gracia squares, etc.).

description: A penthouse in Sant Antoni? The quintessence of Barcelona!
host_about:
Somos unos apasionados de los viajes. Tanto, que ¡nos hemos convertido en profesionales! 

Estamos muy orgullosos de haber empezado alquilando apartamentos en Barcelona a viajeros nacionales e internacionales. Llevamos más de una década alquilando apartamentos a familias, grupos de amigos, parejas... y realmente siempre ha sido una experiencia muy gratificante para nosotros. Cuando viajamos con nuestros niños, o cuando podemos escaparnos un fin de semana solos, es la opción de alojamiento que más nos gusta. Tenemos independencia, comodidad, conocemos muchos anfitriones nos enriquecen con sus historias y consejos sobre la ciudad y vivimos la ciudad casi casi como un local más.

Nos gusta sentirnos a gusto cuando viajamos, por eso es lo que intentamos ofrecer siempre a nuestros huéspedes. Tenemos un pequeño equipo que nos ayuda para lograr una mejor atención y que se esfuerza por hacer de la experiencia lo mejor posible. 

Esperamos verte pronto! Y no dudes en contactarnos para lo que necesites. 

Lodging Team

description: Extremly spacious and bright apartment for up to 8 people, having an excellent location in Barcelona. (Eixample, Barcelona, Spain)
neighborhood_overview: Passeig de Gràcia is the main artery of the new Eixample. It was created in 1860 when the city walls were demolished. Following the Cerdà plan, the district was built with money from the wealthy families of Barcelona. The bourgeois of the city were competing in aesthetic refinement with the construction of their modernist buildings. The interiors and facades were richly decorated with the most diverse materials. The Eixample dreta (right side of the district) goes from Balmes Street to paseo Sant Joan and the street of Naples. You can find there several of the main places of interest in Barcelona such as Plaça Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia, la Pedrera, Casa Batlló, etc.

name: Apartment with terrace and pool
description: 3 bedrooms apartment with pool and terrace, close to Ciutadella Park in Barcelona. (Eixample, Barcelona, Spain)
neighborhood_overview:
The location of this apartment is excellent: a short walk from the famous Arc de Triomf and the Parc de la Ciutadella (a really nice park very popular among young people and families). Plaça de Catalunya (the main square in Barcelona) and its variety of bars, restaurants and shops is really close to the apartment too. Visit the Barri Gòtic (the gothic town) with its quaint narrow streets and street artists.

Do not forget to visit the Born, one of the three districts of Ciutat Vella. Walk along its streets full of shops, small cafes and restaurants with delicious tapas. Visit the Picasso Museum and the Chocolate Museum, or take a walk along the Passeig Joan Borbó down to la Barceloneta.
Really close to the Metro station Arc de Triomf (L1).

description: Show up and start living from day one in Barcelona with this sophisticated two bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped El Fort Pienc home with stunning balcony views over the city. (ID #BCN172)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished home is located in the central neighborhood of El Fort Pienc. It’s a mostly residential area that’s home to Auditori, a premier concert hall where you can enjoy performances by the Barcelona Symphony Orchestra and other international acts. In addition to sidewalk bars and cafés, El Fort Pienc is also where you can visit the Monumental, a museum that offers a glimpse into the history of bullfighting in Catalonia.  This area is well-connected by public transportation, with the Marina and Monumental metro stations providing easy access to other parts of the city.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description:
A spacious apartment with a modern design and three bedrooms, located on Balmes Street, the perfect spot to enjoy with family or friends. This accommodation is ideal for tourists looking to explore everything the area has to offer.

host_about:
Hi there,

My name is Enrique and I am a Barcelona Local. I have always loved traveling myself, but also sharing the beauty and wonders of Barcelona with others, so a few years ago I started renting out 2 apartments to travelers coming to the city, always meeting everyone in person so I could share my insights and hidden secrets about Barcelona :)

Now I rent out a few more apartments and it is no longer just me, but we are a small team of people managing the apartments together, but with the same focus on personal and attentive services in authentic apartments that allow for the genuine Barcelona feel for your trip! We call our little team Stay U-nique, because of this focus on a unique feeling when staying with us.

If you have any questions, want to hear about an apartment or just say hi, don´t hesitate to reach out :)

Have a great day!
Enrique

name: Quiet and cozy room with view over Barcelona
description:
Discover the vibrant city life of Barcelona in this spacious and centrally located accommodation.
From the room, you can enjoy stunning views of the bustling metropolis.
A private bathroom outside the room ensures your privacy.
Right outside the door, you’ll find the red (L1) and blue (L5) metro lines, as well as several bus stops. The main train station (Estació de Sants) is just a 7-minute walk away.
neighborhood_overview:
Plaça de Sants is situated in the heart of the Sants neighborhood, providing excellent access to multiple public transport options, including metro lines, buses, and nearby train connections.

The neighborhood is known for its local, authentic charm and a safe, welcoming atmosphere. It offers a variety of attractions and amenities, including:
• A vibrant market hall, perfect for exploring fresh produce and local specialties
• Numerous trendy bars and cozy cafés
• A wide range of restaurants, from traditional Catalan cuisine to modern international options

Sants is an ideal area for those seeking a genuine Barcelona experience, away from the busiest tourist spots yet still well-connected to the city’s main attractions.

name: Blueground | La Dreta, balcony & AC, nr Sagrada
description: Discover the best of Barcelona, with this three bedroom duplex penthouse in La Dreta de l'Eixample. with balcony views over the mountain. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this modernly Blueground furnished duplex penthouse with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BCN174)
neighborhood_overview:
This busy district in central Barcelona is characterized by wide streets and an elegant atmosphere. L'Eixample is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, including buildings by Antoni Gaudí, and the shopping and dining around the Plaça de Catalunya and along Passeig de Gracia.

This neighborhood is renowned for its upscale shopping and dining, including international boutiques and upmarket restaurants on the Passeig de Gràcia and Rambla de Catalunya. Dreta de l’Eixample is also home to La Sagrada Familia, the iconic (and unfinished) masterwork from architect Antoni Gaudí.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
